message.entry: If X is a row-vector, only the second dimension can be variable-size. All other dimensions must be fixed-size.
If X is fixed-size, all entries of X must be finite. Automatic NaN removal is not supported unless the number of data points is variable.
For code generation, the ''Display'' option must be ''off''.
For code generation, the ''Streams'' option must be [].
For code generation, the ''UseSubstreams'' option must be set to false.
When n is a scalar, it must be a non-negative integer.
A variable-size population input cannot be a non-negative integer scalar at run-time. Consider using a scalar input for n and indexing into the population array with the output of RANDSAMPLE.
